maml:description.maml:para: Removes all data for a site subscription on a metadata Web service application.
Use the Clear-SPMetadataWebServicePartitionData cmdlet to clear all data for a site subscription on a metadata Web service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site subscription configuration to remove.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the service proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
{{Fill FromContentDatabase Description}}
{{Fill FromServiceDatabase Description}}
Specifies the service proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
{{Fill ServiceContext Description}}
{{Fill FromContentDatabase Description}}
{{Fill FromServiceDatabase Description}}

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example removes data for a site subscription on a Metadata Service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Specifies content types for replicating from on-premises to SharePoint Online (SPO) environment.
This cmdlet is used in hybrid scenarios with SharePoint Online to copy Content Types from an on-premises farm to SharePoint Online.

maml:Description.maml:para: Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used. NOTE : When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the AuthEndpoint to use, but not the default one.
Specifies the content type names to be migrated. Can be in a form of an array.
Specifies the administrator account credential of the target SharePoint Online site.
Specifies the GraphApiEndpoint to use, but not the default one.
Specifies the migration source. Can be a local site or a local hubsite.
Specifies the name of the local term store of the local site.
Specifies the migration target. You can input a remote site url or remote hub site url, both will be processed to be the hub site url.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used. NOTE : When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the AuthEndpoint to use, but not the default one.
Specifies the content type names to be migrated. Can be in a form of an array.
Specifies the administrator account credential of the target SharePoint Online site.
Specifies the GraphApiEndpoint to use, but not the default one.
Specifies the migration source. Can be a local site or a local hubsite.
Specifies the name of the local term store of the local site.
Specifies the migration target. You can input a remote site url or remote hub site url, both will be processed to be the hub site url.

maml:description.maml:para: System.String System.String[] System.Management.Automation.PSCredential Microsoft.SharePoint.PowerShell.SPAssignmentCollection

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>Copy-SPContentTypes -LocalSiteUrl http://localsite/ -LocalTermStoreName "managed metadata service application proxy" -RemoteSiteUrl https://contoso.sharepoint.com/ -ContentTypeNames @("ContentTypeA", "ContentTypeB") -Credential (Get-Credential)

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example migrates the specified content types named: ContentTypeA, ContentTypeB on the local site http://localsite/ whose term store named "managed metadata service application proxy" to the hub site of remote site https://contoso.sharepoint.com/. If the remote site is a hub site, the migration target will be itself.

maml:description.maml:para: Copies Managed Metadata Taxonomy Groups from SharePoint on-premises to SharePoint Online.

Use the Copy-SPTaxonomyGroups cmdlet to copy specified Metadata groups from an on-premises environment to SharePoint Online in a Hybrid SharePoint setup. SharePoint Online becomes the authoritative source for the copied Taxonomy Group. All updates to the Taxonomy Group must be made in SharePoint Online. Once a Taxonomy Group is copied, it cannot be re-copied.

maml:Description.maml:para: Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the Azure Active Directory Graph API authentication endpoint. By default, the well-known endpoint will be used.
Specifies the Taxonomy Term Store administrator credential of remote SharePoint Online Term Store.
Writes data to remote Term Store, so a Term Store Administrator's credential is needed to perform the operations.
Specifies the Azure Active Directory Graph API endpoint. By default, the well-known endpoint will be used.
Specifies the name array of Taxonomy groups in local on-premises term store that will be copied to remote SharePoint Online Term store.
Specifies the Url of local SharePoint on-premises site that contains the local Taxonomy Term Store.
Specifies the name of local Taxonomy Term Store in the SharePoint on-premises farm.
Specifies the Url of remote SharePoint Online site that contains remote Taxonomy Term Store.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the Azure Active Directory Graph API authentication endpoint. By default, the well-known endpoint will be used.
Specifies the Taxonomy Term Store administrator credential of remote SharePoint Online Term Store.
Writes data to remote Term Store, so a Term Store Administrator's credential is needed to perform the operations.
Specifies the Azure Active Directory Graph API endpoint. By default, the well-known endpoint will be used.
Specifies the name array of Taxonomy groups in local on-premises term store that will be copied to remote SharePoint Online Term store.
Specifies the Url of local SharePoint on-premises site that contains the local Taxonomy Term Store.
Specifies the name of local Taxonomy Term Store in the SharePoint on-premises farm.
Specifies the Url of remote SharePoint Online site that contains remote Taxonomy Term Store.

maml:description.maml:para: System.Uri System.String[] System.Management.Automation.PSCredential Microsoft.SharePoint.PowerShell.SPAssignmentCollection

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$credential = Get-Credential PS C:\>Copy-SPTaxonomyGroups -LocalTermStoreName "Managed Metadata Service Application Proxy" -LocalSiteUrl "http://sharepoint" -RemoteSiteUrl "http://contoso.sharepoint.com" -GroupNames "Group1","Group2" -Credential $credential

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example copies two taxonomy groups "Group1" and "Group2" from local Term Store to the remote Term Store in "http://contoso.com". These two sites have been enabled with Hybrid Taxonomy.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the data from a metadata Web service for a site subscription.
Use the Export-SPMetadataWebServicePartitionData cmdlet to export the data from a metadata Web service that is associated with the specified site subscription.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site subscription to export.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the service proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.
Specifies the path and file name for the file to create from the exported data.
The type must be a valid path in either of the following forms:
- C:\folder_name\subscription_export
- \\server_name\folder_name\file_name.cab

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
{{Fill NoCompression Description}}
Specifies the site subscription to export.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the service proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.
Specifies the path and file name for the file to create from the exported data.
The type must be a valid path in either of the following forms:
- C:\folder_name\subscription_export
- \\server_name\folder_name\file_name.cab

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a backup of data for a specific site subscription on a Metadata Service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a managed metadata service application.
Use the Get-SPMetadataServiceApplication cmdlet to retrieve a specified managed metadata service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the managed metadata service application to get.
The type must be a valid GUID or the name of a valid managed metadata service application.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the managed metadata service application to get.
The type must be a valid GUID or the name of a valid managed metadata service application.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves an existing managed metadata service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns an existing connection to a managed metadata service application, which is also known as a proxy, to the managed metadata service application.
Use the Get-SPMetadataServiceApplicationProxy cmdlet to get a specified connection to a managed metadata service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the service application proxy to read.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves an existing connection to a managed metadata service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the site subscription configuration settings for a Metadata Service application.
Use the Get-SPSiteSubscriptionMetadataConfig cmdlet to read the site subscription configuration settings for a specified shared service application for the Metadata Service.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site subscription to read.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the proxy of the metadata Service application for the site subscription.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the site subscription-specific settings for an existing partitioned Metadata Service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a TaxonomySession object.
Use the Get-SPTaxonomySession cmdlet to get a TaxonomySession object. A TaxonomySession object contains the set of metadata term stores for a taxonomy session.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the SharePoint site mapped to the set of metadata term stores for the taxonomy session.
The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid URL, in the form http://server_name; or an instance of a valid SPSite object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the SharePoint site mapped to the set of metadata term stores for the taxonomy session.
The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid URL, in the form http://server_name; or an instance of a valid SPSite object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves a TaxonomySession object, which can be used to access term stores associated with the Web application for a site.

maml:description.maml:para: Restores the data for a site subscription.
Use the Import-SPMetadataWebServicePartitionData cmdlet to restore data for a site subscription to a shared service application for the Metadata Service.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site subscription to import.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.
Specifies the path and name of the subscription data file to import.
The type must be a valid path in either of the following forms:
- C:\folder_name\formtemplate_name
- \\server_name\folder_name\file_name.cab

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies whether to overwrite the existing site subscription data, if it exists.
{{Fill NoCompression Description}}
{{Fill ToContentDatabase Description}}
{{Fill ToServiceDatabase Description}}
Specifies the site subscription to import.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription.

Specifies the path and name of the subscription data file to import.
The type must be a valid path in either of the following forms:
- C:\folder_name\formtemplate_name
- \\server_name\folder_name\file_name.cab

Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. command:example.maml:title: ------- -------------------EXAMPLE---------------------- -------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example restores a backup of Metadata Service application data for a specific site subscription on a Metadata Service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new managed metadata service application.
Use the `New-SPMetadataServiceApplication` cmdlet to create a new managed metadata service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the name of the service application to create. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
A comma-separated list of user accounts or service accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that may create and run the service application. The accounts must already exist.
Specifies an existing IIS application pool in which to run the new managed metadata service application.
The value must be a GUID that is the identity of an SPServiceApplicationPool object; the name of an existing application pool, or an instance of an SPServiceApplicationPool object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies an interval, in seconds, that a front-end Web Server should wait before asking the application server for changes. This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The mininum value is 1, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 10.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the PSCredential object that contains the user name and password to be used for database SQL authentication.
If SQL authentication is to be used, either DatabaseCredentials must be specified or both the DatabaseUserName and DatabasePassword parameters must be set.
The type must be a valid PSCredential object.
Specifies the name of the database to create for the new managed metadata service application.
The type must be a valid name of a SQL Server database; for example MeatadataDB1.
Specifies the name of the host server for the database specified in DatabaseName.
The type must be a valid name of a SQL Server database; for example SqlServerHost1.
Specifies the name of the host server for the failover database server.
The type must be a valid SQL Server host name; for example, SQLServerHost1.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read/write permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery. The accounts must already exist.
Specifies the fully qualified URL of the site collection that contains the content type gallery that the service will provide access to.
Specifies the maximum number of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) channels that a front-end Web server should hold open to the application server.
This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The minimum value is 0, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 4.
Specifies that the service application restrict data by subscription.
Note This property cannot be changed after the service application has been created.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read-only permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery.
The accounts must already exist.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given permission to read the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery; and permission to write to open term sets and local term sets and to create new enterprise keywords.
The accounts must already exist.
Enables reporting of errors when content types are imported.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Disables partition quotas.
Specifies if the upgrade process is to be deferred and manually completed.
Specifies the name of the service application to create. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
A comma-separated list of user accounts or service accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that may create and run the service application. The accounts must already exist.
Specifies an existing IIS application pool in which to run the new managed metadata service application.
The value must be a GUID that is the identity of an SPServiceApplicationPool object; the name of an existing application pool, or an instance of an SPServiceApplicationPool object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies an interval, in seconds, that a front-end Web Server should wait before asking the application server for changes. This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The mininum value is 1, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 10.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the PSCredential object that contains the user name and password to be used for database SQL authentication.
If SQL authentication is to be used, either DatabaseCredentials must be specified or both the DatabaseUserName and DatabasePassword parameters must be set.
The type must be a valid PSCredential object.

The type must be a valid name of a SQL Server database; for example MeatadataDB1.
Specifies the name of the host server for the database specified in DatabaseName.
The type must be a valid name of a SQL Server database; for example SqlServerHost1.
Specifies the name of the host server for the failover database server.
The type must be a valid SQL Server host name; for example, SQLServerHost1.

Specifies the maximum number of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) channels that a front-end Web server should hold open to the application server.
This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The minimum value is 0, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 4.
Specifies that the service application restrict data by subscription.
Note This property cannot be changed after the service application has been created.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read-only permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery.
The accounts must already exist.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given permission to read the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery; and permission to write to open term sets and local term sets and to create new enterprise keywords.
The accounts must already exist.
Enables reporting of errors when content types are imported.

Sets the maximum number of Term Groups per partition.
Sets the maximum number of Labels per partition.
Sets the maximum number of Properties per partition.
Sets the maximum number of Term Sets per partition.
Sets the maximum number of Terms per partition.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a new managed metadata service application.
This example creates a new managed metadata service application and specifies a content type hub to be used for syndication. It also enables error reporting during syndication.
This example creates a new managed metadata service application that is partitioned, for use by sites in a subscription.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new connection to a managed metadata service application.
Use the `New-SPMetadataServiceApplicationProxy` cmdlet to create a new connection to a managed metadata service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the display name of the service application proxy to create. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies that existing instances of changed content types in subsites and libraries will be updated.
Specifies that this connection will provide access to the content types that are associated with the managed metadata service application.
Specifies that the connection be added to the default proxy group for the farm.
Specifies that new enterprise keywords will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata service application.
Specifies that the term set that is created when you create a new managed metadata column will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata application.
Specifies that the service application restrict data by subscription.
This property cannot be changed after the service application proxy has been created.
Specifies the local managed metadata service application to connect to. The service application must exist on the local farm.
The type must be a valid GUID; a valid name of the service application; or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceApplication object.
Specifies the URI of a remote managed metadata service application to connect to.
To specify the managed metadata service application that this proxy is connecting to, you must set only the URI parameter or only the ServiceApplication parameter.

The type must be a valid URL, in the form urn:schemas-microsoft-com:sharepoint:service:fa5c65ebed244a15817768825004f3a7#authority=urn:uuid:acdd6deff6sd4bb899f5beb42051bf3b7&authority=https:// <server>:32844/Topology/topology.svc.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the display name of the service application proxy to create. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`

Specifies that new enterprise keywords will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata service application.
Specifies that the term set that is created when you create a new managed metadata column will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata application.
Specifies that the service application restrict data by subscription.
This property cannot be changed after the service application proxy has been created.
Specifies the local managed metadata service application to connect to. The service application must exist on the local farm.
The type must be a valid GUID; a valid name of the service application; or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceApplication object.
Specifies the URI of a remote managed metadata service application to connect to.
To specify the managed metadata service application that this proxy is connecting to, you must set only the URI parameter or only the ServiceApplication parameter.

The type must be a valid URL, in the form urn:schemas-microsoft-com:sharepoint:service:fa5c65ebed244a15817768825004f3a7#authority=urn:uuid:acdd6deff6sd4bb899f5beb42051bf3b7&authority=https:// <server>:32844/Topology/topology.svc.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example creates a connection to a managed metadata service application in the local farm.
This example creates a partitioned connection to a managed metadata service application in the local farm.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes site subscription configuration settings.
Use the `Remove-SPSiteSubscriptionMetadataConfig` cmdlet to remove the site subscription-specific configuration settings for a specified Metadata Service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site subscription for which to remove the Metadata Service application settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the local metadata service proxy for the service application containing the site subscription-specific settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the site subscription for which to remove the Metadata Service application settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the local metadata service proxy for the service application containing the site subscription-specific settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example removes the site subscription-specific settings from an existing partitioned Metadata Service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the properties of a managed metadata service application.
Use the `Set-SPMetadataServiceApplication` cmdlet to set the properties of a managed metadata service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the managed metadata service application to update.
The type must be a valid GUID or the name of a valid managed metadata service application.
A comma-separated list of user accounts or service accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that may create and run the service application. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any existing values for the FullAccessAccount, ReadAccessAccount and RestrictedAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Specifies an existing IIS application pool in which to run the Web service for the managed metadata service application.
The value must be a GUID that is the identity of an SPServiceApplicationPool object; the name of an existing application pool; or an instance of a valid SPServiceApplicationPool object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Specifies the interval, in seconds, that a front-end Web server should wait before asking the application server for changes. This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The mininum value is 1, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 10.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the PSCredential object that contains the user name and password to be used for database SQL authentication.
If SQL authentication is to be used, either the DatabaseCredentials parameter must be specified or both the DatabaseUserName and DatabasePassword parameters must be set.
The type must be a valid PSCredential object.
Specifies the name of the database that contains the term store for the managed metadata service application.
The type must be a valid name of a SQL Server database; for example MeatadataDB1.
Specifies the name of the host server for the database specified in DatabaseName.
The type must be a valid name of a SQL Server database; for example SqlServerHost1.
If this flag is set, the packages will not be unpublished. If the HubUri parameter is changed, all content type packages will be unpublished by default.
If the HubUri parameter is not changed, this flag has no effect.
Specifies the name of the host server for the failover database server.
The type must be a valid SQL Server host name; for example, SQLServerHost1.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read/write permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any existing values for the AdministratorAccount, ReadAccessAccount and RestrictedAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Specifies the new name of the service application. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given permission to read the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery and permission to write to open term sets and local term sets and to create new enterprise keywords. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any previous values for the FullAccessAccount, ReadAccessAccount and AdministratorAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Enables reporting of errors when content types are imported.
Specifies the fully qualified URL of the site collection that contains the content type gallery that the service will provide access to.

Specifies the maximum number of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) channels that a front-end Web server holds open to the application server. This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The minimum value is 0, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 4.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read-only permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any previous values for the FullAccessAccount, RestrictedAccount and AdministratorAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
When in partitioned mode, disables the partition quota.

The type must be a valid GUID or the name of a valid managed metadata service application.

Specifies the name of the host server for the failover database server.
The type must be a valid SQL Server host name; for example, SQLServerHost1.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read/write permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any existing values for the AdministratorAccount, ReadAccessAccount and RestrictedAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Specifies the new name of the service application. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given permission to read the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery and permission to write to open term sets and local term sets and to create new enterprise keywords. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any previous values for the FullAccessAccount, ReadAccessAccount and AdministratorAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Enables reporting of errors when content types are imported.
Specifies the fully qualified URL of the site collection that contains the content type gallery that the service will provide access to.

Specifies the maximum number of Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) channels that a front-end Web server holds open to the application server. This value is set per timer job, client application, or Web application.
The minimum value is 0, and there is no maximum value. The default value is 4.

Specifies a comma-separated set of application pool accounts in the format <domain>\<account> that will be given read-only permission to the managed metadata service's term store and content type gallery. The accounts must already exist.

If a value is set by using this parameter, any previous values for the FullAccessAccount, RestrictedAccount and AdministratorAccount parameters are removed. Consider setting all four parameters at the same time.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
When in partitioned mode, disables the partition quota.
When in partitioned mode, sets the maximum number of groups per partition.
When in partitioned mode, sets the maximum number of labels per partition.
When in partitioned mode, sets the maximum number of properties per partition.
When in partitioned mode, sets the maximum number of term sets per partition.
When in partitioned mode, sets the maximum number of terms per partition.

command:example.maml:title: ------ --------------------EXAMPLE 1--------------------- ------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$sa = Get-SPMetadataServiceApplication -Identity 'Managed Metadata Service Application' PS C:\>Set-SPMetadataServiceApplication -Identity $sa -HubUri 'http://sitename' -SyndicationErrorReportEnabled

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example adds a content type hub to an existing managed metadata service application. It also enables error reporting when content types are imported.

command:example.maml:title: ------ --------------------EXAMPLE 2--------------------- ------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\>$sa = Get-SPMetadataServiceApplication -Identity 'Managed Metadata Service Application' PS C:\>Set-SPMetadataServiceApplication -Identity $sa -AdministratorAccount 'contoso\username1' -FullAccessAccount 'contoso\AppPoolAccount1,contoso\AppPoolAccount2' -RestrictedAccount 'contoso\AppPoolAccount3,contoso\AppPoolAccount4,contoso\AppPoolAccount5' -ReadAccessAccount 'contoso\AppPoolAccount6'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets permissions on an existing managed metadata service application.

If you use Windows PowerShell to set any of the account values, you should set all of them. The `Set-SPMetadataServiceApplication` cmdlet first erases all accounts, then adds the accounts that you specified.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the properties of a connection to a managed metadata service application.
Use the `Set-SPMetadataServiceApplicationProxy` cmdlet to set the properties of a connection to a managed metadata service application.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the connection to update.

The type must be a GUID that represents the identity of the connection to modify, the name of a valid connection to a managed metadata service, or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies that existing instances of changed content types in subsites and libraries will be updated.
Specifies that this connection will provide access to the content types that are associated with the managed metadata service application.
Specifies that new enterprise keywords will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata service application.
Do not make more than one connection the default keyword location.
Specifies that the term set that is created when you create a new managed metadata column will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata service application.
Do not make more than one connection the default location for site collection term sets.
Specifies the new display name of the connection. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
Specifies that the connection be added to the default proxy group of the farm.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the connection to update.

The type must be a GUID that represents the identity of the connection to modify, the name of a valid connection to a managed metadata service, or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies that existing instances of changed content types in subsites and libraries will be updated.
Specifies that this connection will provide access to the content types that are associated with the managed metadata service application.
Specifies that new enterprise keywords will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata service application.
Do not make more than one connection the default keyword location.
Specifies that the term set that is created when you create a new managed metadata column will be stored in the term store associated with the managed metadata service application.
Do not make more than one connection the default location for site collection term sets.
Specifies the new display name of the connection. The name can contain a maximum of 128 characters.
Specifies that the connection be added to the default proxy group of the farm.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example enables content type syndication and enables content type pushdown on an existing connection to a managed metadata service application.
This example disables content type syndication and disables content type pushdown on an existing connection to a managed metadata service application.

This example configures an existing connection to a managed metadata service application to be the default location for storing enterprise keywords and prevents it from being the default location for storing column-specific term sets.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the site subscription configuration settings for a specified Metadata Service application.
Use the `Set-SPSiteSubscriptionMetadataConfig` cmdlet to set the site subscription-specific settings for a specified shared service application for the Metadata Service.

For permissions and the most current information about Windows PowerShell for SharePoint Products, see the online documentation at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=251831).

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the site subscription for which to set the Metadata Service application settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.
Specifies the local metadata service proxy for the service application that contains the site subscription-specific settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
{{ Fill DoNotUnpublishAllPackages description}}
Specifies the URI of the syndication hub.
The type must be a valid URI, in the form file:\\server_name\sitedocs.
Enables error reporting for content type syndication.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
Specifies the site subscription for which to set the Metadata Service application settings.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of a site subscription (for example, SiteSubscriptionConfig1); or an instance of a valid SiteSubscription object.

The type must be a valid GUID, in the form 12345678-90ab-cdef-1234-567890bcdefgh; a valid name of the service application proxy (for example, ServiceAppProxy1); or an instance of a valid SPMetadataServiceProxy object.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the `Stop-SPAssignment` command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`
{{ Fill DoNotUnpublishAllPackages description}}

The type must be a valid URI, in the form file:\\server_name\sitedocs.
Enables error reporting for content type syndication.
Displays a message that describes the effect of the command instead of executing the command. For more information, type the following command: `get-help about_commonparameters`

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example sets the content type syndication hub and disables syndication error reporting for a specific site subscription on an existing partitioned Metadata Service application.

maml:description.maml:para: Stops Content Type replication job to SharePoint Online.
Stops Content Type replication job to SharePoint Online and deletes the replication timer job.

maml:Description.maml:para: Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Stops Content Type replication job to SharePoint Online.

maml:description.maml:para: Terminates Hybrid SharePoint Taxonomy replication from SharePoint Online site to local SharePoint on-premises site.

Use the Stop-SPTaxonomyReplication cmdlet to terminate Hybrid SharePoint Taxonomy replication from SharePoint Online site to local SharePoint on-premises site. The Taxonomy Groups Replication timer job will be killed and a full replication from SharePoint Online Taxonomy store to local SharePoint on-premises store will be performed.

maml:Description.maml:para: Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
This is the Taxonomy Term Store administrator credential of remote SharePoint Online Term Store.
Fetches full taxonomy data properties, so a Term Store Administrator's credential is needed to perform the operations.

Manages objects for the purpose of proper disposal. Use of objects, such as SPWeb or SPSite, can use large amounts of memory and use of these objects in Windows PowerShell scripts requires proper memory management. Using the SPAssignment object, you can assign objects to a variable and dispose of the objects after they are needed to free up memory. When SPWeb, SPSite, or SPSiteAdministration objects are used, the objects are automatically disposed of if an assignment collection or the Global parameter is not used.

When the Global parameter is used, all objects are contained in the global store. If objects are not immediately used, or disposed of by using the Stop-SPAssignment command, an out-of-memory scenario can occur.
This is the Taxonomy Term Store administrator credential of remote SharePoint Online Term Store.
Fetches full taxonomy data properties, so a Term Store Administrator's credential is needed to perform the operations.

maml:description.maml:para: Microsoft.SharePoint.PowerShell.SPAssignmentCollection

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example performs a full replication and deletes the Taxonomy Groups Replication timer job. If the full replication fails, you can run the cmdlet again. The credential is a SharePoint Online tenant administrator credential.
